Pre-Game Insights: Cameroon hosted the event two years ago and secured a third-place finish.
Guinea advanced to the knockout stages in the previous tournament.
Kick-Off: Monday; 15 January 2024, 05:00 PM GMT (10:30 PM IST)
Location: Charles Konan Banny Stadium
Cameroon (all competitions): L-L-W-D-D
Guinea (all competitions): W-D-W-L-W
Frank Magri, the young Cameroonian striker currently playing for Toulouse in Ligue 1, is known for a distinct playing style that blends finesse with a ruthless finishing instinct.
Serhou Guirassy has netted 17 goals in 14 Bundesliga matches for Stuttgart in the 2023-24 season.
In their most recent six encounters, Cameroon and Guinea have each secured victory twice, with two matches ending in draws.
Guinea have won the previous two matches against Cameroon.
Cameroon have secured just one win in their last five international matches and drew against Zambia in their recent warm-up game.
Bryan Mbeumo of Brentford will be absent from the Cameroon squad as he underwent ankle surgery last month, ruling him out of the tournament.
Cameroon’s number one, Andre Onana is questionable for this encounter after committing to play against Tottenham.
Cameroon suffered a huge blow as Aboubakar will miss the AFCON after sustaining an injury in training.
Guinea enter this match with a clean bill of health, indicating that all players are in good physical condition without any reported injuries or health concerns.
Matches: 19

Draws: 7
Cameroon predicted lineup: Epassy; Castelletto, Wooh, Moukoudi, Tolo; Ntcham, Kemen, Anguissa; Ngamaleu, Ekambi, Magri
Guinea predicted lineup: Kone; Conte, Jeanvier, Diakhaby, Sylla; Camara, Konate, Keita; Guilavogui, Kamano, Guirassy
Cameroon’s recent performance have been less than stellar, marked by a drawn warm-up match against Zambia and being held to a tie by Libya in a World Cup qualifier back in November.
Guinea enter the upcoming match with high confidence, having secured a friendly victory against Nigeria.
Prediction: Cameroon 1-1 Guinea
